snippet: Obstetrician-gynecologists are barred in most cases from treating men, even at times when many experts say they could be of help.
abstract: Men with pelvic pain have found themselves unable to seek treatment from obstetrician-gynecologists due to a stringent rule issued by the American Board of Obstetrics and Gynecology that prohibits gynecologists from treating men for some conditions; specialty group International Pelvic Pain Society says gynecologists often have the most skill in treating this type of pain.
lead_paragraph: Obstetrician-gynecologists are barred in most cases from treating men, even at times when many experts say they could be of help.

headline.main: Men With Pelvic Pain Find a Path to Treatment Blocked by a Gynecology Board
headline.print_headline: Men With Pelvic Pain Find a Path to Treatment Blocked by a Gynecology Board

keywords.value: American Board of Obstetrics and Gynecology
keywords.name: organizations
